H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H1212.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Uri<SDBH:אוּרִי>}, tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► craftsman working on {L:tabernacle<SDBH:מִשְׁכָּן>}

H221.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Hur<SDBH:חוּר>}; tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► father of {L:Bezalel<SDBH:בְּצַלְאֵל>}

H2354.def: = white cloth; ◄ woven out of either linen or cotton; ► used for making clothes or to decorate the house; ≈ regarded as valuable and therefore symbolizing high status

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

101.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4399.def: = an activity involving a physical effort and usually requiring a certain amount of training or skill

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H4284.def: = procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H5178.def: = a reddish-brown metal, ◄ mined from the hills, ► and used, together with {L:tin<SDBH:בְּדִיל>}, for the production of bronze

H2799.def: = causative process by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4399.def: = an activity involving a physical effort and usually requiring a certain amount of training or skill

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1835.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fifth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and first son of {L:Bilhah<SDBH:בִּלְהָה>}, slave of {L:Rachel<SDBH:רָחֵל>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H4150.def: = an action by which two or more parties come together for a particular purpose

H727.def: = relatively large wooden box ► used for storage

glosses: cover, lid (of the ark of the covenant)
H3727.def: = a flat, rectangular object with two golden figures with wings on its top, made out of hammered gold, ► and used to cover the {L:Covenant Box<SDBH:אֲרֹון>}, which represented the presence of YHWH among his people; this is also the place where, once a year, on the Day of Atonement, blood from sacrificial animals was sprinkled; ≈ associated with atonement

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7979.def: literally: something that has been spread out; hence: = a flat surface on which food has been spread out for eating ◄ usually made of wood but can be a piece of animal skin or leather ► used in private and public occasions, and frequently for sacred uses in the tabernacle and temple

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H2889.def: = state in which an object is free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present

H4501.def: = stand ► designed to hold one or more lamps so that the lamps can light a large area

H4196.def: = construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

H7004.def: = smoke ◄ produced by burning sacrifice or incense ► in order to please God with its smell

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H7004.def: = smoke ◄ produced by burning sacrifice or incense ► in order to please God with its smell

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H5514.def: = mountain and surrounding desert on the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt, also known as Mount {L:Horeb<SDBH:חֹורֵב>}; ► location where {L:YHWH<SDBH:יהוה>} entered into a {L:covenant<SDBH:בְּרִית>} with {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H676.def: = one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body
